core_checklist.title: Core Quality Checklist
core_checklist.description: These items apply to all PRs regardless of type
items: The PR solves the problem it claims to solve
Code follows project conventions and style guidelines
New code has appropriate tests
All errors are properly handled
Public APIs have doc comments (if applicable)

bug.title: üêõ Bug Fix Requirements
bug.description: Since this PR is labeled as a **bug fix**, please ensure:
items: **Root cause documented** - Explain what caused the bug in the PR description
**Reproduction test added** - Test that fails on main branch without the fix
**Test passes with fix** - The reproduction test passes with your changes
**Regression prevention** - Test will catch if this bug reoccurs in the future
**Fix is minimal** - Changes are focused only on fixing the bug
**Related bugs checked** - Verified no similar bugs exist in related code
bug.footer: **Why this matters:** Bugs without tests often reoccur.

enhancement.title: ‚ú® Feature/Enhancement Requirements
enhancement.description: Since this PR adds new functionality:
items: **Feature scope documented** - Clear description of what the feature does
**API design reviewed** - Public APIs are intuitive and well-designed
**Comprehensive tests** - All functionality is tested (happy path + edge cases)
**Examples provided** - Usage examples in code comments or separate example files
**Documentation updated** - User-facing docs reflect new functionality
**Breaking changes noted** - If any, migration guide provided
**Performance considered** - No obvious performance regressions
enhancement.footer: **Consider:** Can this feature be split into smaller, incremental PRs?

new feature.title: ‚ú® New Feature Requirements
new feature.description: Since this PR adds a new feature:
items: **Feature scope documented** - Clear description of what the feature does
**API design reviewed** - Public APIs are intuitive and well-designed
**Comprehensive tests** - All functionality is tested (happy path + edge cases)
**Examples provided** - Usage examples in code comments or separate example files
**Documentation updated** - User-facing docs reflect new functionality
**Breaking changes noted** - If any, migration guide provided
**Performance considered** - No obvious performance regressions
new feature.footer: **Consider:** Can this feature be split into smaller, incremental PRs?

breaking-change.title: üí• Breaking Change Requirements
breaking-change.description: Since this PR contains breaking changes:
items: **Breaking changes documented** - Clear list of what breaks
**Migration guide provided** - Step-by-step instructions for users
**Deprecation considered** - Could this be done with deprecation warnings first?
**Version bump planned** - Major or minor version bump needed
**Alternatives explored** - Why is breaking change necessary?
**Impact assessed** - How many users/use cases affected?
breaking-change.footer: **Note:** Breaking changes should be discussed with maintainers before implementation.

documentation.title: üìö Documentation Update Requirements
items: **Accuracy verified** - Technical details are correct
**Examples tested** - Code examples actually work
**Links valid** - All links work and point to correct versions
**Grammar/spelling** - Text is clear and well-written
**Formatting correct** - Markdown/formatting renders properly
**Up-to-date** - Reflects current codebase state
documentation.footer: **Suggestion:** Have someone unfamiliar with the feature review for clarity.

internal.title: üè† Internal Change
internal.description: This PR is marked as **internal** (not user-facing):
items: **No API changes** - Public APIs unchanged
**No behavior changes** - External behavior identical
**Refactoring/maintenance** - Code improvements only
**Tests still pass** - All existing tests pass without modification
internal.footer: **Lighter review:** Internal changes may have lighter review requirements.
